author: Sruthisagar Yamunan
text:
Union Environment Minister Prakash Javadekar seems to have taken control of the BJP’s alliance talks in Tamil Nadu with sources indicating that he spoke with a senior DMDK leader over phone a few days ago and is likely to meet the Leader of the Opposition Vijayakant this week.

Sources in the BJP said the lull in activity on the alliance front was largely due to the Minister focussing on his Ministry’s needs in the upcoming Union Budget.

“Both Mr. Javadekar and Union Power Minister Piyush Goyal are busy preparing estimates for their respective Ministries for the Union Budget. They are expected to come down to Tamil Nadu this week to directly talk to Mr. Vijayakant about the alliance,” said a senior leader. The Ministers were identified by BJP national president Amit Shah to oversee poll preparations in Tamil Nadu.

The leader said the high command wanted to wind up alliance talks by February 20 and move to the first phase of electioneering before March. Most Union Ministers are expected to campaign in the State in next month with Prime Minister Narendra Modi expected to make multiple visits.

Last week, at a consultation meeting in Kochi, Mr. Shah gave the go-ahead for tours by six senior leaders of the BJP Tamil Nadu unit. They are expected to focus on specific regions and tour individually to cover as much ground as possible.

“The delay in finalising alliances has put the release of the manifesto on hold. But any more delay might hurt the party. Whatever the outcome, we would have to hit the ground by March 1,” the leader added.

BJP is keen

on concluding

alliance

talks by

February 20
title: Javadekar, Vijayakant meeting likely this week
